Tris.Action: Expresses panic and pleads for more time before making a life-altering choice.
Sits quietly with brother and neighbor, struggles to speak but shows gratitude by saying 'Thanks, brother...'
Tris wakes up on testing day and prepares herself calmly, showing awareness of the importance of the day.
Tris panics and pleads when forced to choose immediately in the dream, showing hesitation and lack of confidence under pressure.
Tris struggles to speak when Caleb wishes her good luck, indicating possible social discomfort or uncertainty.
Thanks her brother Caleb sincerely.
Wants to say more to Caleb but holds back.
Asks Tori about her tattoo, showing curiosity and openness.
Looks ashamed after asking a question, indicating insecurity or self-consciousness.
Drinks unknown liquid from Tori despite hesitation, showing trust.
Tris looks like she wants to say more to Caleb but holds back, showing hesitation.
Tris sits gracelessly in the chair, showing some awkwardness or lack of confidence in the situation.
Tris asks a curious question about the hawk tattoo despite feeling ashamed, showing intellectual curiosity and willingness to engage.
Tris opens her mouth to respond but closes it again, unable to articulate her thoughts, indicating uncertainty or lack of confidence.
Tris drinks the unknown liquid despite not knowing what it is, showing trust and willingness to comply with instructions.
Stays absolutely still and bows to the growling dog, successfully calming it and gaining its acceptance.
Hurls her body and pins the dog to protect the girl, showing quick physical response and bravery.
Looks thoughtful and scared when confronted by the man with the newspaper, but maintains composure and denies knowing the murderer.
Initially tenses up and questions why she should choose between cheese and knife, showing hesitation.
Shows signs of recognition and fear but manages to keep a blank expression and lie convincingly.
Lies to the man on the bus about knowing him to protect herself.
Throws herself at the dog to protect the girl, showing selflessness.
Lies to the man on the bus, showing awareness of social manipulation but also dishonesty.
Throws herself at the dog to protect the girl, demonstrating quick selfless action and courage.
Shows confusion and hesitation when processing the test results and their implications.
Remains silent and cautious about revealing her Divergent status despite pressure, indicating prudence and self-control.
Nods in confusion but respects Tori's serious warning and keeps the secret.
Responds politely and sincerely to her father with 'Thank-you father.'
Nods despite confusion, showing willingness to listen and process important advice.
Hesitantly turns and leaves after receiving serious instructions, indicating some uncertainty or lack of immediate confidence.
Politely thanks her father with confidence before the Choosing Ceremony.
Hesitates visibly before choosing her faction, showing internal conflict and sensitivity to others' expectations.
Draws blood and chooses her faction despite fear and tension in the room, demonstrating sincerity and courage.
Reacts tensely to her father's accusing look but notices her mother's supportive smile, indicating awareness of family dynamics and emotional sensitivity.
Does not verbally respond or explain her choice to others in the scene, showing restraint or possible emotional distance.
Walks very slowly and hesitantly to the bowls, showing indecision and shivering at the pain of drawing blood.
Despite hesitation, draws blood and makes a choice by dropping blood onto the burning coals, symbolizing commitment.
Jumps hesitantly from a seven-story ledge despite fear, showing courage and trust in the process.
Hesitates before giving her name, showing sincerity and thoughtfulness in self-presentation.
Jumps last off a seven-story ledge into a dark hole with no visible safety, showing courage and willingness to face fear.
Hesitates and moves slowly to the edge before jumping, indicating initial fear but eventual resolve.
Successfully lands in the net and climbs off shakily, demonstrating physical capability and survival skill despite nervousness.
Hesitates before stating her name but then chooses it with certainty, showing thoughtful decision-making under pressure.
Looks around to count the initiates left, showing awareness and attentiveness.
Wears an Abnegation uniform among others, indicating difference but no explicit social interaction.
Looks around, counting the initiates left, showing awareness and attention to detail.
Wears an Abnegation uniform among Erudite and Candor initiates, indicating confidence in her identity despite standing out.

Responds to Christina's surprise about never having had hamburgers with slight amusement and curiosity, giggles and rolls her eyes when joking about leaving because of the food, accepts Christina's handshake and introduces herself.
Accepts Christina's handshake confidently and introduces herself clearly.
Shows confusion about common food and the concept of free time during training.
Lies awake at midnight, eyes tear up, quietly wipes tears away, shows vulnerability but does not disturb others.
Lies awake at midnight, quietly processing emotions and wiping away tears without drawing attention.
Looks pensive and tears up quietly, then quickly wipes away her tears.
Practices fighting techniques diligently despite physical discomfort (skin reddening and cracking).
Tris tries out punch #1 and practices subsequent punches and kicks despite initial lack of power and visible physical strain.
Responds politely to Al by shaking his hand and introducing herself.
Looks for words to describe Four, showing thoughtfulness and sincerity.
Smiles at Al’s words after he admits to crying, showing acceptance and friendliness.
Tris tries kick #1 again despite initial failure, showing persistence and willingness to learn.
Tris forgets to breathe and stands unmoving after Four’s correction, indicating momentary lapse in composure and focus.
Tris thoughtfully searches for the right word to describe Four, showing awareness and reflection.
Tris engages politely and confidently in social interaction with Al, shaking his hand and responding appropriately.
Tris looks bewildered at the concept of getting a tattoo, showing unfamiliarity or hesitation with new ideas.
Smiles at Al’s words and shares a playful moment with Christina.
Defensively refuses to change her appearance (hair, piercings) despite peer pressure.
Curiously asks Christina about her clothes when Christina criticizes them.
Allows Christina to apply makeup and change her appearance despite initial resistance.
Refuses to conform to superficial changes like cutting or dyeing her hair despite peer pressure.
Allows Christina to take control and drag her into situations without asserting her own preferences initially.
Shows curiosity and openness by asking about her clothes and eventually allowing Christina to makeover her to be more noticeable.
Admits to never having been allowed to stare at her reflection for so long, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Moves close to Tori and suggests they should talk, indicating trust and willingness to connect.
Chooses tattoos to represent family she left behind, showing emotional connection and sincerity.
Recognizes the significance of Torí's warning and initiates a discreet conversation to gain more information.
Chooses a tattoo symbolizing a new life and family she left behind, showing thoughtful reflection and intentionality.
Appears hesitant and hurried when commenting on her reflection, indicating discomfort and lack of confidence in self-perception.
Follows Christina out of the shop relieved at the change of subject, showing avoidance rather than confronting her feelings.
Is intensely focused while watching Christina being assaulted repeatedly by Molly, does not intervene or speak up.
Tris is intensely focused while watching the fight between Molly and Christina.
Tris does not intervene or react outwardly to Christina being assaulted repeatedly.
Confronts Peter despite her injuries, showing resilience but also a guarded attitude.
Shows skepticism and does not immediately trust Al's reassurance about Peter stopping his harassment.
Smiles at Al's self-deprecating humor, indicating friendliness and appreciation of camaraderie.
Advances on Peter despite being injured, confronts him verbally with confidence.
Wincing from injuries while confronting Peter, showing physical vulnerability but still assertive.
Expresses doubt about Peter stopping his harassment despite advice from Al and Christina.
Seeks information about Will from Al, showing awareness and concern.
Refuses to fake a fight and face losing again, showing determination to face challenges honestly.
Responds to Molly's taunts with controlled aggression and focus rather than insults or hostility.
Drives her elbow into Molly’s face and continues to beat her after Molly asks her to stop.
Responds angrily and refuses to stop fighting Molly, citing past harm.
Freezes and tries to avoid confrontation when mocked and humiliated by Peter, Molly, and Drew.
Attempts to escape after Peter yanks off her towel, exposing her naked body.
Dodges Molly's attack and counters effectively by driving her elbow into Molly's face, causing Molly to lose balance.
Rushes forward and uses a knee strike to Molly's side after knocking her down.
Continues to beat Molly despite Molly's plea to stop, driven by anger.
Freezes at the dormitory door when confronted by Peter, Molly, and Drew laughing at her.
Fumbles at her drawer to extract a dress quickly when mocked and threatened.
Attempts to leave but is blocked by Peter, then tries to run when Drew threatens to look under her towel.
Runs out naked after Peter yanks off her towel, showing vulnerability and loss of control.
Punches Molly again while being restrained by Four, showing persistence and fighting skill.
Struggles against Four's arms but is unable to break free.
Runs towards her mother, tears in her eyes, hugs her mother and collapses into her arms.
Glares at Four after relaxing from struggle.
Walks away after telling Four she is fine, despite internal doubts.
Relaxes after winning but glares at Four, showing controlled confidence.
Insists she is fine despite Four's concern, demonstrating emotional self-regulation and confidence.
Walks away calmly after confrontation, showing composure.
Runs to hug her mother and collapses into her arms, showing vulnerability and emotional openness.
Encourages her mother to be honest about her father's absence by saying 'You can tell me if he didn’t want to come.'
Responds sympathetically to her mother's explanation about the tension and restrictions, saying 'That's terrible.'
Introduces Four to her mother politely, calling him 'just one of my instructors' and downplaying intimidation.
Avoids elaborating or defending Four when he is cold to her mother, remaining neutral and not escalating tension.
Introduces Four to her mother confidently and explains his role as her instructor.
Looks down and seems hesitant when discussing her father not visiting.
Expresses shock upon hearing her mother’s explanation about her father’s selfishness.
Defends her mother fiercely against Cara's insults, threatens physical violence to protect her.
Shows anger and intolerance toward Cara's accusations, refuses to listen to opposing views.
Defends her mother aggressively and confidently against Cara's insults.
Threatens physical violence impulsively in a heated argument.
Expresses strong certainty and determination to prove others wrong despite limited knowledge.
Admits to being ranked near the bottom and looks down in shame.
Hesitates and speaks softly about her inconclusive aptitude results, showing vulnerability.
Asks questions and shows curiosity about her situation despite warnings.
Admits she is ranked close to the bottom in fighting and looks down in shame.
Hesitantly reveals her aptitude test results were inconclusive despite pressure not to share.
Shows confusion and surprise when warned to stay in the middle and avoid attention during initiation.
Insists on understanding her mother's request before acting, showing a desire for clarity and sincerity.
Expresses disregard for how others perceive her attachment to her family, indicating sincerity and emotional openness.
Questions her mother for explanation before agreeing to a risky task, showing critical thinking and assertiveness.
Follows her mother quickly after seeing a tattoo, indicating alertness and curiosity.
States she doesn't care what others think, showing confidence and emotional resilience.
Stands with friends to view rankings calmly despite Molly's outrage and glare.
Accepts Will's friendly hug and smile after rankings are announced.
Ranks sixth after the first round of fights, showing solid performance among peers.
Remains calm and composed despite Molly's outrage and challenge to the rankings.
Does not react aggressively or defensively to Molly's hostility, showing emotional control.
Kneels next to Edward after he is stabbed, speaks calmly to him, encourages him to breathe and wait for the doctor.
Calms Edward after he is stabbed, instructing him to breathe and wait for the doctor instead of panicking or removing the knife herself.
Expresses anxiety about whether she was good enough, showing some self-doubt despite her capable actions.
